page.title: 13A LOCAL FACTORY
page.content: Cross & Blackwell, tomato ketchup (produced as the result of a takeover of Libby's by the Nestle group, who also own Cross & Blackwell) and fruit juices, which includes Um Bongo and a highly successful Moonshine drink which in June 1985 sold its 500th million carton. Other changes include the factory modernisation as computers now play an important role in production. Despite this the workforce consisting of local people is 211, twice the original.The transportation of products is now carried out by road and not so much by rail as in the past owing to the easy access to the M6 & A6.The output is up from the factory thanks to new machinery and a Â£3.8 million investment.Wages which were originally 8d an hour for a 17 yr old have increased keeping place with inflation.
